page.title: 18POLLUTION
page.content: {Crop Spraying} a quick and effective method of distributing chemicals and fertilisers on land and growing crops, but spray may be carried in the wind to pollute the neighbouring area,or drain into streams and rivers. {Corn Stubble Burning} Burning is an efficient way for farmers to deal with corn stubble, but pollution occurs when the wind rises or changes direction. Clouds of smoke fill the air, and smuts blow into open windows Hedges are set alight.There are therefore laws governing the burning of stubble and farmers liable to prosecution if these are not adhered to.{Muck Spreading{Effluent from the {chicken}farm and neighbouring sewage works are spread on the land as a source of manure.This causes unpleasant smells.{Low flying RAF {aircraft}is very noisy.
